<!-- end of table folio -->
<TABLE WIDTH="80%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.3.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>Final Assembly: At </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>minimum</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, samples selected for inspection will have completed the assembly process post final weigh scale (if used), and
prior to shrink-wrapping.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.3.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>Subassembly: At </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>minimum</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, samples selected for inspection will have completed the sub-assembly process.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Inspection Requirements:</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Final Assembly:</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>All final assembly samples are inspected through the subassembly level unless the subassemblies were built, sampled, and inspected prior to final assembly. All inspections will be performed
in a manner that will not damage or destroy any components.<BR></FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4.1.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Visual Defects</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4.1.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Build Accuracy</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Subassembly</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4.2.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Visual Defects</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.4.2.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Build Accuracy</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Defect Classifications:</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Major</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.1.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Cosmetic:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Pages unglued, large spots, streaking, gouges, tears, or nicks on the visible ("Panel A") area impacting copy and/or graphics; coating defects that
affect the visual appearance of the component, i.e., blistering, peeling, cracking, or creasing over more than 25% of the print area.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.1.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Damaged</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Any defect that affects the functionally of the component. This can include, but not be limited to, broken, cracked, crushed, defaced, gouged, and
torn.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.1.3</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Extra</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Additional security sensitive component(s) found in product. Security sensitive components include CDs, CD Keys, Diskettes, Dongles, and Serial Number
Labels.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.1.4</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Missing</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Required component(s) not found in product.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.1.5</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Wrong</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Incorrect component(s) found in product or serialization matching error.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Minor:</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.2.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Cosmetic</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Slight dog-ears of pages or a slightly bent cover, coating has slight cracking, or minor folding defects; minor scratches, smudges, hickeys, spots, nicks,
 streaks, or creases that cover minimal surface areas and do not render copy/graphics illegible.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.2.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Extra</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Additional component(s) not classified as security sensitive.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.5.2.3</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Orientation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: Component(s) not in order specified, label placement incorrect or skewed.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.6</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Acceptance Requirements:</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.6.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Accept&nbsp;= 0 Reject&nbsp;= 1</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.6.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Rejected lot(s) is segregated and 100% inspected/reworked.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.6.3</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
If sub-lots were utilized in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.1.2, the turnkey supplier's process must be able to accurately identify and segregate the sub-lots for 100% inspection and rework.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

criteria.</FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>

5.8.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>

documentation, evaluation, segregation, and disposition of nonconforming product.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
5.9</B></FONT></TD>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Executive Summary</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;This Document</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
document describes the processes and environment under which the Adobe Order Fulfillment business will be managed at Sykes. The document itemises the activities undertaken,
required performance standards and associated negotiated costs. The Statement of Work (SOW) should be seen as a live document and updated as and when necessary.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
procedural charts are uncontrolled documents and are subject to change.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe Order Fulfillment Expectations</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>[*]</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Service Management</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Overall
responsibility for the performance and management of the Adobe Order Fulfillment lies with the Client Account Manager (CAM) The CAM reports to the Client Services manager who
in turn reports to the Director of Business Operations (CPS).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Account Management Structure&nbsp;&amp; Responsibilities</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Sykes organisational structure consists of a core management team dedicated to Adobe programmes with responsibility for delivering all aspects of a clients business, whether it is
implementation of a project or discussing a new service. The Account or Project owner sit in the centre of the circle and call on the skills, knowledge and expertise of specialist functions within the
organisation.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Client Account Manager</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>[*]</I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.2</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;New Project Implementation</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
CAM will be the project leader for all new project introductions for Adobe Order Fulfillment. This management process will include:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Chairing
regular launch meetings&#151;internal&nbsp;&amp; external
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Provision
and monitoring of all project timelines and milestone delivery</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;Escalation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appropriate
escalation processes are in place to ensure continuity and control of the business. Any problem that is deemed to be business critical will be immediately escalated to the
appropriate level to ensure appropriate remedial as well as long term is taken.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Issues
should be escalated through correct channels, the following identifies the escalation within Sykes:</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[artwork]</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.3.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Complaints</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
complaints raised by Adobe will be addressed through Sykes Corrective Action process that is governed by Sykes quality process QS04/01&#151;See Appendix&nbsp;A.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
the event of any quality complaints received from the field, the following action will be taken:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Immediate
escalation to Adobe
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Internal
Sykes Action Request Form raised to responsible area
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
remaining stocks of defective SKU quarantined
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Quality
check of all remaining stock
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Results
informed to Adobe and remedial action agreed</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Products&nbsp;&amp; Services</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Component Management</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
component specifications provided by Adobe are held on Sykes server in Galashiels, which is backed up each day of the working week. As contingency hard copy of all component
specifications are held at our Print facility.</FONT></P>

count (if applicable)

has accurate and unique part number

BOMS delivered to Sykes 8 weeks prior to product launch
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Finalised
BOMS to Sykes 4 weeks prior to launch</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

responsibilities.</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>BOMS
accurately- entered on to Sykes production system. The process for this task is included as Appendix&nbsp;B&#151;IPC06 Creation of Bill of
Materials
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>[*]</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Existing BOMS</B></FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments to existing BOMS is governed by Sykes quality processes&#151;see Appendix&nbsp;C -IPC07 Amendment of Bill of Materials.</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Obsolete BOMS</B></FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe is required to advise Sykes of all BOMS and component part numbers that are obsolete. Sykes are responsible for the deletion of these entries from Sykes
inventory systems within [*] of notification by Adobe.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2.2</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Product Assembly</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe
responsibilities:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
provision of adequate forecasting
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Identification
of both Make to Stock (MTS) and Build to Order (BTO) requirements
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Provision
of PO, split by SKU and price to initiate order cycle&#151;this PO should send via EDI message from Adobe SAP to Sykes production system</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
responsibilities:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Receipt
and acknowledgement of PO via EDI message to Adobe SAP
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Establishment
of component availability
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Release
of work order for product assembly
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Confirmation
of work order completion against Adobe PO number via EDI massage to Adobe SAP
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Complete
order within [*] working days, assuming all components are available</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following illustrates the timetable for order completion:</FONT></P>

process&#151;see appendix&nbsp;E.</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=55,EFW="2010831",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",CHK=281915,FOLIO=55,FILE='DISK039:[00PAL0.00PAL1710]NN1710A.;18',USER='ILEONG',CD='17-APR-2000;14:48 -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.4&nbsp;&nbsp;EDI Messaging Timescales</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
PO, assembly and shipping process requires the interaction of Sykes systems with Adobe's SAP. The details are as follows:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
will pick-up Adobe transmission every hour on the half hour. These transmissions will consist of the electronic documents:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>850&#151;Purchase
Order
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>860&#151;Put-chase
Order Change
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>940&#151;Shipping
Order
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>997&#151;Document
Receipt Acknowledgement</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe
will-send these documents every hour on the hour. Sykes will send Adobe transmissions every hour on the half hour. These transmissions will consist of the electronic
documents:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>855&#151;PO
Confirmation
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>856&#151;Shipping
(Build) Notification
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>945&#151;Shipping
Confirmation
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>997&#151;Document
Receipt Acknowledgement</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
will return the 855 within 1&nbsp;day of receiving a purchase order. Shipping (Build) notifications will be sent within 1&nbsp;hour of goods being booked onto Sykes system.
The Shipping Confirmation will be transmitted within 1&nbsp;hour of the shipment being confirmed in Sykes system.</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe
will send the Purchase Order document within 1&nbsp;hour of a purchase order being created in Adobe's system. Purchase Order changes will be sent within 1&nbsp;hour of
creation. Shipping Orders will be sent within 1&nbsp;hour of creation.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Both
Adobe and Sykes will send the Document Receipt Acknowledgement within 1&nbsp;hour of receiving a document.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.5&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory Management</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.5.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory Control</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
are responsible for the management of all Adobe finished goods inventories on behalf held on Sykes MFG-Pro system.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
will also ensure effective management of all component stocks to ensure continuance of supply.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It
is understood that Sykes will be responsible for the accurate management of all stock records and will be responsible for the update of all finished good inventory records on both
Sykes MFG-Pro system and Adobe SAP via SAP terminal access provided by Adobe.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
Adobe finished goods stocks are held in Sykes warehouse in Galashiels, Scotland. Adobe finished goods are stored as complete shrink-wrapped product and held in shipping cartons in
warehouse bin locations</FONT></P>

of the warehouse:</FONT></P>

inventory held in designated Adobe areas to increase picking and counting efficiency

security areas available for storage of high value items</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.6.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Carrier Management</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
have established strong relationships with a number of carriers which are utilised to ship on behalf of Adobe.</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe's
Distributor contracts will necessitate the requirement that Sykes will be required to liase with a high number of carriers with which we have no previous relationship. Sykes
will be responsible for:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Documentation
correct and available
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Scheduling
collections with all carriers</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.6.2</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;EU/Non EU Customs</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
will:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Provide
guidance on all customs clearance and duty issues for all imports into EU
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Ensure
correct duty and tax is paid
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Complete
all necessary documentation for shipments destined for Distributors inside and outside EU boundaries
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Liase
with Customs to resolve issues and enquiries</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Helpdesk</I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Adobe Helpdesk has been set up to provide an efficient method of controlling all Adobe distribution enquiries.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Opening
hours:</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<CENTER><TABLE WIDTH="65%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="25%"><FONT SIZE=2>Monday - Friday</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="72%"><FONT SIZE=2>08:30 - 16:30*</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></CENTER>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*additional
cover is provided between 16.30 and 17.30 but will not provide the full coverage available during normal hours</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Helpdesk
Services&#151;see Appendix&nbsp;M&#151;SOP01 Helpdesk</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.7&nbsp;&nbsp;RMA</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;RMA's
will be handled as per Sykes existing procedures and any requirements to rework/dispose will be agreed prior to any action with Adobe.</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
RMA returned from Goods In within 48&nbsp;hours (&lt;3000 units)
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Full
records of all returned material and subsequent actions are kept
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
open or damaged product will be destroyed</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
existing RMA process is included as Appendix&nbsp;N&#151;SOP07 Adobe RMA</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following illustrates the messaging requirements between Sykes and Adobe for RMA:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>[Exhibit][</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>*]</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=59,EFW="2010831",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",CHK=707947,FOLIO=59,FILE='DISK039:[00PAL0.00PAL1710]NO1710A.;13',USER='MMEYER',CD='15-APR-2000;09:28 -->

<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;General</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Billing</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Assembly</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe
will provide Sykes with an itemised PO for all material cost and assembly requirements. This PO will be:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Split
by SKU (1 SKU per order line) and quantity
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Inclusive
of VAT
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>In
GBP Sterling</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
completion of a finished goods work order Sykes will confirm receipt of the goods on to Adobe SAP via EDI message 856. This message will immediately initiate an automated payment
from Adobe SAP.</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
assume that payments will be:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Received
weekly
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Via
electronic transfer</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1.2</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Services</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
other services including Management Fee, Warehousing, Fulfillment will be covered monthly by Adobe PO.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;Quality</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
quality system has been in operation since 1989 and is designed to ensure Sykes maintain BS EN IS09002 registration.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.3&nbsp;&nbsp;Business Continuity</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes
has developed a business continuity plan to ensure the continuity of supply to Adobe. The plan is a dynamic document and is reviewed bi-annually.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
plan has 2 main goals:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Continuity
of service provision to Adobe
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Re-establishment
or normal operations</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

will provide the following reports to Adobe Order Fulfillment</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>This procedure should be used when any of the following are received or highlighted:</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>A

report of product nonconformity related to Sykes Europe Limited activity;</FONT></P>

report of component nonconformity;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>A
nonconformity raised during any audit (i.e., internal, client, 2<SUP>nd</SUP> or 3<SUP>rd</SUP> party);</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>A
Sykes Europe Limited Quality System nonconformity or nonconformity relating to ISO 9002;</FONT></P>

improvement or nonconformity identified by anyone regarding the activities of Sykes Europe Limited.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Shortage Escalation Checklist</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Stock shortages should be investigated in the following order:</B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Double
check location indicated on Pick List.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Check
locations adjacent/opposite location indicated on Pick List.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
Direct Stock&#151;check stock history and if RMA stock, check RMA shelving.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Check
Despatch Note/GRN/Purchase Requisition and ascertain if product has been wrongly booked in or incorrectly bin to binned.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Stock
check other items in location for shortages and overs (see point 6).
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Check
open batch consolidated Pick Slips for incorrect Picks.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Check
old locations (up to I year).
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
Client carries both Trade and Direct stock where transfers are conducted, check remaining department stock.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Sweep
warehouse.</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>NOTE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> If instructed by the Client/Client Services, orders may be partial or zero shipped at any stage in the above escalation path.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>This
material constitutes confidential and proprietary information of Adobe Systems, Inc., and is directed to the person to whom it is given by an authorized representative of Adobe Systems, Inc. This
material may not be distributed, reproduced or divulged without written consent of Adobe Systems, Inc. This material, along with all copies made by or on behalf of the person to whom it is directed,
shall be returned immediately to Adobe Systems, Inc. upon Adobe Systems Inc.'s request.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Pre-Packing:</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Does
the Part Number on the products picked match that specified on the order?<BR>
Does the actual quantity of products picked match that specified on the order?<BR>
Do the Shipping details match those specified on the order?<BR>
Are the products picked free from damage/deterioration e.g. not torn, faded, stained, marked, creased&nbsp;etc.?<BR>
Is the product packaging intact?</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Contingency Plan</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
the event of Sykes Gala being unable to print orders from Adobe Trade System:</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Request
Adobe to print/Fax Despatch Note batch and consolidated Pick Lists at Gala.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Manually
pack orders and pass to Shipping Office for UPS Maxiship system processing.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Manually
ship confirm orders when Adobe Trade System is fully operational.</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>This
material constitutes confidential and proprietary information of Adobe Systems, Inc., and is directed to the person to whom it is given by an authorized representative of Adobe Systems, Inc. This
material may not be distributed, reproduced or divulged without written consent of Adobe Systems, Inc. This material, along with all copies made by or on behalf of the person to whom it is directed,
shall be returned immediately to Adobe Systems, Inc. upon Adobe Systems Inc.'s request.</FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Goods In Quality checks</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the delivery is of a pallet of boxes&#151;open 1 box and count the number of items in it.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Goods In Quality Checks</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the delivery is boxes of large items&#151;open 1 box and count the number of items in it.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the delivery is boxes of small items&#151;open 1 box and count a part of the box as a sample.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Does the actual number of items match the number on the box?</B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>If </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>YES,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> record this in the Goods In Database.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>NO,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> record this in the Goods In Database and inform the Client Team Manager.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>QUALITY CHECKS:</B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Check
the total quantity of the delivery.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Find
the checking quantity from the table below.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>When
you have checked them, have you found faults which would reject the order?</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="77%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="29%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Quantity Delivered</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Check</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="40%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Accept the Delivery</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Reject the Delivery</B></FONT><BR></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=4 ALIGN="CENTER"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="29%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Between 2 and 10000</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>20</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>If no items are faulty</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[<SUP>*</SUP>]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=4 ALIGN="CENTER"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="29%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Between 10001 and 150000</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>80</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>If no items are faulty</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[*]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=4 ALIGN="CENTER"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="29%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Between 150001 and 500000</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>125</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>If no more than 1 Item is faulty</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[*]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=4 ALIGN="CENTER"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="29%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>500001 and over</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>200</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>If no more than 1 item is faulty</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[*]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=4 ALIGN="CENTER"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Information
based on BS 6001 Part&nbsp;1&nbsp;:&nbsp;1991 (ISO 2859-1&nbsp;:&nbsp;1989) Level 1&#151;Reduced (AQL 0.25%)</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>YES,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> record the number you checked, the number which passed and the number which failed in the Goods In database and 'Inform the Client Team Manager.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>NO,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> record the number you checked, the number which passed and the number which failed in the Goods In Database.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>What to Check for: Compare the Samples Against the 1st Article Sign Off Copy</B></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<TD WIDTH="22%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Component Types:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%"><FONT SIZE=2>Reasons for Rejection:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="22%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>All Components:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
Anything that is different from the 1st Article Sign Off copy. Any physical damage of any kind.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="22%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Printed Components:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
Loose pages in books. Colour changing from 1 sample to another. Faults which affect either the appearance of tile printed component or its use. (e.g. marks, torn pages, ink smudges, creased covers or pages, missing, extra or duplicate pages or
sections).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="22%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Media: Disks</B></FONT></TD>

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<TD WIDTH="76%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
Colour changing from 1 sample to another, Ink smudges.</FONT></TD>
</TR>

SYKES EUROPE LIMITED, a company incorporated in Scotland under the Companies Act with registered number 86519 and having its registered office at Nether Road, Galashiels, Selkirkshire, TD1 3HE (hereinafter called "Sykes")</FONT></TD>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS:</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(A)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Adobe
is a member of a group of companies which is a world leader in the development, licensing and distribution of desktop publishing software;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(B)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Adobe
wishes to be provided with a variety of logistical services to support and facilitate its development, licensing and distribution in Europe, the Middle East and Africa;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(C)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
is willing to provide such services on the following terms and conditions.</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>NOW THEREFORE IT IS AGREED AS FOLLOWS:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>In
this Agreement unless the context otherwise requires, the following expressions shall bear the following meanings:</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="76%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>"Adobe Databases"</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>shall mean the Adobe databases from time to time made available by Adobe to Sykes or created by Sykes pursuant to the provision of Services hereunder;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
"Adobe Direct"</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
shall mean Adobe's direct sales organisation designed to allow Registered End Users to acquire Adobe product upgrades, selected Adobe retail products, Adobe type and complementary Third Party Products and to provide Registered End Users with the
latest information on Adobe upgrades and offers;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TR>

shall mean ASN CSRs and/or CSRs as the case may be;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>

<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>

<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
shall mean this Agreement between Adobe and Sykes;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>

shall mean a customer services representative allocated to the provision of ASN Services and forming part of the ASN Team;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>

<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
shall mean all countries in the world other than the United States of America, Canada, Japan, China, India, Australia, New Zealand, Iran, Iraq, Cuba, Libya and North Korea and the countries comprised in South East Asia and Latin America, and such
other countries as the parties may agree in writing from time to time (such agreement not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed);</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
"ASN Database"</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
shall mean the database of ASN Members and their registration, programme and other details;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

reference to the singular shall include a reference to the plural and vice versa, and a reference to any gender includes a reference to all other genders.

are for convenience only and shall not affect interpretation.</FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;APPOINTMENT</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-exclusive appointment</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Adobe
hereby appoints Sykes and Sykes hereby accepts appointment as a non-exclusive provider of the Services during the Contract Term, subject to the terms of this Agreement. As at the Effective Date,
Adobe hereby instructs Sykes to provide all the Services detailed in this Agreement but, consistent with the non-exclusive nature of this appointment, Adobe shall be entitled at any time to
discontinue and/or suspend the provision by Sykes of any or all of the Services by giving a reasonable period of notice which shall not be less than forty-five (45) days.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
Adobe, during the Contract Term, seeks (1)&nbsp;any extension to the existing Services provided under this Agreement, or (2)&nbsp;the provision of new services similar to the services provided
by Sykes which are not covered by this Agreement, Sykes shall have the opportunity to tender for the provision of such new services.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
warrants and undertakes to Adobe that the Services shall at all times be provided in accordance with this Agreement, the Services Schedules (including but not limited to the
Performance Standards and Performance Metrics) and the Statement of Work.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Adobe
shall be entitled by thirty (30) days' prior written notice to amend the Statement of Work provided that such amendments will not have a material impact (whether requiring an
increase or decrease) on the resources required by Sykes to provide the Services. Any such proposed amendments (including amendments to LifeLine or any other Adobe Database to</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

NOSHADE></FONT></P>

<UL>

the Statement of Work refers) which will have a material impact (whether requiring an increase or decrease) on such resources shall be approved in advance in writing by Sykes, acting reasonably.

in advance in writing by Adobe, acting reasonably.</FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Where
policies and procedures outlined in the Statement of Work are amended from time to time within the relevant Adobe Databases or within Lifeline, such amendments shall be deemed
to vary the Statement of Work accordingly.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For

Adobe, it shall be Sykes' responsibility to ensure that all Services are performed as described in the relevant Services Schedule and the Statement of Work.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Resources</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Without
prejudice to specific obligations elsewhere in this Agreement, Sykes shall at all times devote sufficient resources and teams of sufficiently qualified personnel to enable it to provide the
Services efficiently and professionally. Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, or any Performance Standard or Performance Metric set in relation to the Services, Sykes shall provide
the Services to the standards which would reasonably be expected of a competent company which is providing the Services on an arms length basis and Sykes shall at all times perform the Services
courteously and in such manner as not to injure Adobe's name or damage Adobe's goodwill.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;No breach</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
hereby represents to Adobe that Sykes will not be in breach of any existing obligation binding on Sykes by reason of its entering into this Agreement.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Services</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
undertakes and agrees that it will upon request provide Adobe with such additional Services as Adobe may from time to time require during the Contract Term as long as the request conforms with
Commercial Practices and at prices to be agreed by the parties. If such Services are requested and included in this Agreement, the parties shall agree the terms of a Services Schedule in relation to
such Services (or such amendments to existing Services Schedule(s) as may be appropriate) together with such additions and/or amendments to the Statement of Work as may be appropriate.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Reporting and Performance Metrics</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
shall provide such reports, information and data as Adobe shall from time to time reasonably require in relation to the performance of this Agreement. This shall include but is not limited to
reports on the Performance Standards and Performance Metrics which shall be produced by Sykes in relation to each Service in the terms set out in the relevant Services Schedule and/or the Statement of
Work and the production by Sykes of all other reports, information and data more particularly specified in the Schedule and the Statement of Work. Reports on the Performance Metrics shall include all
reports on the Performance Standards. Sykes shall ensure that all reports on the Performance Metrics and Performance Standards contain charts which show sufficient historical data to identify trends,
clearly understood titles and labels, the goal or objective, a clear indication of which direction is good and which is bad and a scale which does not distort trends. Sykes shall ensure that all
Performance Standards are drawn to the attention of all relevant employees. Sykes shall ensure that all Direct Sales and ASN</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Performance

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Services provided in Adobe's name and Grant of Licence</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>All
Services provided shall be provided by Sykes in the name of Adobe. So far as required by Sykes for the proper performance of its duties hereunder during the Contract Term and for no other purpose
whatsoever, Adobe shall use its reasonable endeavours to procure for Sykes a non-exclusive royalty-free limited licence to use specified trade marks, service marks, trade names and logos belonging to
or licensed by Adobe or any member of the Adobe Group pertaining to the Products. Such licence shall automatically terminate on the date of termination or expiry of this Agreement howsoever terminated
or expiring and with effect from such date Sykes shall have no further right to use any such trade marks, service marks, trade names or logos of Adobe or any member of the Adobe Group pertaining to
the Products or their licensors.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.8</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Intellectual Property</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>It
is hereby expressly agreed that Adobe shall be the sole and exclusive owner of all Intellectual Property rights in all work carried out by Sykes (or on behalf of Sykes) in the provision of the
Services including but not limited to copyright in reports, manuals, electronic files and technical notes authored by Sykes, copyright and database rights in any and all databases created or updated
and copyright and related rights in any and all software developed by Sykes in the performance of the Services, to the extent that such software is bespoke software commissioned from Sykes by Adobe
and charged to Adobe. Where Adobe has funded such software development, Sykes shall only be entitled to use such software for the exclusive benefit of Adobe during the Contract Term, and any
transitional period described in Clause 14.6(a). In the event Sykes develops any other software under this Agreement for the benefit of Adobe and other Sykes clients, the parties shall agree how, if
at all, the development costs of such software shall be apportioned. In any event, Adobe shall be entitled to a licence to use such software on terms to be agreed between Adobe and Sykes, provided
that such terms shall include, as minimum terms, an irrevocable, worldwide, royalty free licence to use, sub-license to any member of the Adobe Group, and reproduce such software in connection with
the Services during the Contract Term, and any transitional period described in Clause 14.6(a). Sykes hereby assigns as legal and beneficial owner to Adobe, by way of future assignation any and all
such Intellectual Property rights which are capable of future assignation and on Adobe's request shall assign as legal and beneficial owner all other such Intellectual Property rights. Sykes shall
procure the waiver by all persons involved in the creation or development of any such works of such moral or similar rights as such persons may from time to time have in or in relation to such works.
Without prejudice to the foregoing, Sykes undertakes to do all such things and execute (or procure the execution of) all such documents as Adobe shall from time to time require in order to perfect
Adobe's title to same and obtain any applicable protections in Adobe's name and to confirm such waivers including but not limited to procuring assignations and waivers in Adobe's favour from
contractors and consultants. Sykes warrants and represents to Adobe that it is entitled to assign such Intellectual Property to Adobe and that such Intellectual Property does not infringe the
Intellectual Property rights or moral or similar rights of any third party.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.10</FONT><FONT

<UL>

to the relevant Services. Sykes shall ensure that the relevant members of the Management Teams shall attend and hold such meetings as Adobe shall from time to time reasonably require including but not
limited to the QBR (which will be held in the month following expiry of each Adobe Financial Quarter during the Contract Term) and the other regular meetings scheduled in the Statement of Work in
relation to each of the Services.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.11</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Quality Control</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
addition to any specific quality control mechanisms included from time to time in any Services Schedules and/or the Operation Manual and without prejudice to the Performance Standards, Adobe shall
be entitled:&#151;</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>upon
twenty-four (24) hours' advance notice to Sykes, to monitor responses to Incoming Requests (whether calls taken or e-mails or other written responses supplied or otherwise) and
to analyse the quality and quantity of call logging; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>at
any time (s) and as it deems appropriate to carry out written, telephone or other surveys of End Users and ASN Members as to their experience with Services provided to them.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;DIRECT SALES SERVICES</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Services to be supplied</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>11</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><HR
NOSHADE></FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=11,EFW="2010831",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="6",CHK=719361,FOLIO=11,FILE='DISK039:[00PAL0.00PAL1710]LA1710B.;3',USER='MMEYER',CD='15-APR-2000;03:00 -->
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Subject
to the terms of this Agreement, Sykes agrees to provide Adobe with the Direct Sales Services and the Finance Services during the Contract Term for the sums set out in the Charges Schedule and
in accordance with the terms set out in the Direct Sales Schedules and the Statement of Work.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Recruitment, Training and Teams</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
shall recruit CSRs and other members of the Direct Sales Team meeting the profile contained in the Statement of Work and shall ensure that the Direct Sales Team at all times meets the
requirements in all material respects (which shall mean that there are no adverse or detrimental effects on the Performance Standards) in terms of numbers, structure and seniority set out in the
Statement of Work and the forecasted requirements of Adobe from time to time, in the terms set out in the Statement of Work. Sykes shall ensure that all members of the Direct Sales Team undergo and
satisfactorily complete the Direct Sales Training and without prejudice to the foregoing, that the Direct Sales Team is at all times adequately trained and resourced in accordance with Adobe's
reasonable requirements from time to time. Sykes shall monitor all CSRs and obtain training evaluations from such CSRs as detailed in the Statement of Work. Sykes' compliance with this provision shall
not relieve Sykes of its obligation to achieve the Performance Standards.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance Standards</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
shall perform the Direct Sales Services to the Performance Standards set out in the Direct Sales Schedules and/or the Statement of Work. Sykes further acknowledges and agrees that a consistent
failure to meet the standards, goals and objectives identified in the Performance Standards and/or the Performance Metrics shall be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement as specified in
Clause 14.3. Without limiting the foregoing, Sykes agrees to use all reasonable endeavours to achieve the performance standards described as "Targets" in the Statement of Work.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe's responsibilities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Adobe
shall provide the services detailed in the Direct Sales Schedules to support Sykes in the provision of Direct Sales Services together with such other services as may be specifically identified
as a responsibility of Adobe in the Statement of Work;</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;ASN SERVICES</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>4.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Services to be supplied</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Subject
to the terms of this Agreement, Sykes agrees to provide Adobe with the ASN Services and the Finance Services during the Contract Term at the prices set out in the Charge Schedule in accordance
with the terms set out in the ASN Schedule and the Statement of Work.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>4.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Recruitment, Training and Teams</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
shall recruit ASN CSRs meeting the profile contained in the Statement of Work and shall ensure that the ASN Team at all times meets the requirements in all material respects (which shall mean
that there are no adverse or detrimental effects on the Performance Standards) in terms of numbers, structure and seniority set out in the Statement of Work. Sykes shall ensure that all members of the
ASN Team undergo and satisfactorily complete the ASN Training and without prejudice to the foregoing, that the ASN Team is at all times adequately trained and resourced in accordance with Adobe's
reasonable requirements from time to time. Sykes shall monitor all ASN CSRs and obtain training evaluations from such ASN CSRs as detailed in the Statement of Work. Sykes' compliance with this
provision shall not relieve Sykes of its obligation to achieve the Performance Standards.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;REMUNERATION</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Invoicing</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Within
nineteen (19) days of the end of each Adobe Financial Month during the Contract Term, Sykes shall invoice Adobe for all work carried out in the previous Adobe Financial Month
calculated as set out in the Charges Schedule. Such invoices shall clearly specify amounts due for each of the Services. Each such invoice shall be accompanied by such supporting documentation and
vouchers as Adobe may reasonably require. Except as provided in Clause 5.2, and further provided that such invoice is accurate and fully supported, Adobe agrees to pay each such invoice within thirty
(30) days of the date of such invoice which for the avoidance of doubt shall be the date of the end of the relevant Adobe Financial Month.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Within
nineteen (19) days of the end of each Adobe Financial Month, Sykes shall also provide Adobe with a written statement of the amounts received by Sykes on behalf of Adobe
during the previous Adobe Financial Month from all sources in relation to Services provided. Sykes shall ensure that all sums received or receivable in this respect shall be payable to and paid to
Adobe and shall be paid into such nominated Adobe accounts as Adobe shall notify Sykes from time to time. In no event and under no circumstances shall Sykes receive sums from End Users or ASN Members
or in any other manner on its own account in relation to the Services but if for any reason any such sums are received, they shall be held in trust for Adobe and immediately paid to Adobe in such
manner as Adobe shall direct.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Withholding Payment</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Without
prejudice to its other rights hereunder Adobe shall not be obliged to make payment of any sums pursuant to Clause 5.1 if:&#151;</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
has unreasonably refused or failed to perform any Services as and when requested by Adobe; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
has failed to perform any or all of the Services in accordance with the Performance Standards and/or the Performance Metrics such that, in Adobe's reasonable judgement, there
has been or is likely to be a materially adverse effect on the Service(s) in question; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>any
of the circumstances specified in Clause 14.3 has arisen.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;No expenses</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Except
as specifically provided herein Sykes shall not be entitled to receive any remuneration or be reimbursed in respect of any expenses incurred by it in the performance of its duties hereunder.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;VAT</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>All
payments due hereunder shall be exclusive of Value Added Tax or its equivalent and shall be made in Sterling.</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.5</FONT><FONT

<UL>

<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
shall keep full, adequate and accurate books of account and other records reflecting the management, operation and financial results of the Services at its normal place of
business. Such books and records shall, at all times, be kept in all material respects in accordance with good administrative, and secretarial practice and generally accepted accounting principles.
Title to such books and records shall vest in Sykes.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Such
books of account and all relevant records shall be open upon reasonable prior notice during normal working hours and at reasonable intervals for inspection by a duly authorised
representative or representatives of Adobe for the purpose of verifying the accuracy of all payments made or to be made by or to Adobe pursuant to this Clause&nbsp;5. Provided that Adobe has access
to all information necessary to verify the accuracy of all payments made to or to be made by Adobe pursuant to this Clause 5, Sykes shall not be obligated to provide Adobe with access to records
relating to Sykes' profitability in the provision of the Services or access to any records containing other Sykes client information. For the avoidance of doubt, where such records may contain Adobe
information and information relating to other Sykes clients, Sykes shall provide Adobe with properly redacted versions of such records.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Interest
shall be payable on all sums which are due and payable hereunder to or by Adobe (other than amounts which are the subject of a bona fide dispute between the parties) from the due date for
payment as specified herein until payment in full is made at the rate of 2% per annum above the Base Rate from time to time of the Bank of Scotland.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Review</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Without
prejudice to the other provisions of this Clause 5 but subject to the provisions of Clause 5.8, the parties agree that the Charges Schedule shall be reviewed by the parties on an annual basis
with the first such review occurring one (1)&nbsp;year after the Effective Date. Such reviews shall be conducted in order to ensure that the Charges Schedule is competitive. If, following any such
review, the parties are not able to agree a new Charges Schedule, the last Charges Schedule shall remain in force until the next review subject to this Clause 5. It is acknowledged and agreed between
the parties that, notwithstanding each such review, there is no obligation on Adobe to instruct Sykes to provide Adobe with any Service during the Contract Term.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.8</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Most favourable terms</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
at any time during the Contract Term Sykes or any Sykes Associated Company provides services similar to the Services or any of them to any third party on terms which are more favourable in respect
of such services than the terms provided herein then the parties agree that the terms applying to provision of such Services hereunder shall at the request of Adobe be amended to provide for such
favourable terms but nothing contained in this Clause 5.8 shall oblige Sykes to disclose the identity of any such third party. Sykes shall be bound to inform Adobe immediately if any such
circumstances arise.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.9</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Disputes referred to expert</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
parties agree that any dispute regarding sums due to or by Sykes in terms of this Agreement shall be referred for final settlement to a Chartered Accountant nominated jointly by the parties or
failing agreement as to such nomination within seven days after either party's request to the other therefor as nominated at the request of either party by the President for the time being of the
Institute of Chartered Accountants of Scotland. Such expert shall be deemed to act as an expert and not as an arbiter. His/her decision in the absence of clerical or manifest error shall be final and
binding on the parties and his/her fees for so acting shall be borne by the parties in equal shares unless he/she determines that the conduct of either party is such that such party should pay all or
a major part of such fees.</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;CLIENT GROUP MANAGER</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
order for Adobe to monitor and review the Services, Sykes undertakes and agrees to appoint one individual to be primarily responsible to Adobe for the Services who shall be the Client Group
Manager. The Client Group Manager shall meet with such of Adobe's management as Adobe shall deem necessary no less frequently than once each month during the Contract Term, or more frequently if this
is required by the relevant Performance Standard or by Adobe at any time during the Contract Term. In addition, Sykes undertakes and agrees to appoint a separate service manager for each or any of the
Services, if requested by Adobe. For the avoidance of doubt this Clause 6 is without prejudice to any other managing structure requirement or reporting requirement specified in any Performance
Standards or Performance Metrics or elsewhere in this Agreement or the Statement of Work.</FONT></P>

<UL>

agrees that all property of Adobe to be held in the possession of or under the control of Sykes pursuant to this Agreement shall be held at the risk and liability of Sykes, notwithstanding that
title to such property shall at all times remain with Adobe.</FONT></P>

shall obtain and maintain product liability, public liability and professional indemnity insurance policies with caps of not less than [*] in respect of each of such
policies with a reputable insurance</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The

involves the name of the other party without the prior written consent of the other party hereto. Without prejudice to the foregoing generality, neither party shall at any time without the prior
written consent of the other party make or cause or give permission to any employee or any third party to make any untrue or misleading statement in relation to Sykes, any Sykes Associated Company,
Adobe and/or any member of the Adobe Group, nor in particular after the termination of this Agreement represent or cause or permit any representation to be made that Sykes is connected with Adobe
and/or any member of the Adobe Group in relation to the provision of the Services save as required by law or as is publicly available.</FONT></P>

<UL>

<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" shall mean any and all technical and non-technical information in any form, including patent, trade secret and
proprietary information, techniques, sketches, drawings, models, inventions, know-how, processes, apparatus, equipment, algorithms, software programs, software source documents, and formulae related
to current, future and proposed products and services of Adobe and members of the Adobe Group and includes, without
limitation, its respective information concerning research, experimental work, development, design details and specifications, engineering, financial information, procurement requirements, purchasing,
manufacturing, customer lists, business forecasts, sales and merchandising, and marketing plans and information. Without prejudice to the foregoing generality, "Confidential Information" shall also
include any and all information contained in any and all Adobe Databases to which Sykes may have access under this Agreement.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Materials" shall mean all tangible materials containing Confidential Information including, without limitation, all written or
printed documents and computer disks, tapes or CD-ROMs, whether machine or user readable, all PDF (portable document format) files and databases containing any Confidential Information.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

this Agreement, all Confidential Materials, including any copies thereof which Adobe has authorised Sykes to make shall be returned to Adobe immediately.</FONT></P>

</UL>

NOSHADE></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>9.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Restrictions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
agrees that it shall not make use of, disseminate or in any way disclose the Confidential Information or the Confidential Materials to any person, firm, business, company or organisation, except
to the extent necessary to strictly comply with its obligations hereunder. For the avoidance of doubt, (a)&nbsp;Sykes shall not be entitled to use the Confidential Information and/or the
Confidential Materials for any purpose other than to the extent strictly necessary to comply with its obligations hereunder. Sykes shall not circulate (by fax, electronic mail or any other method) any
of the Confidential Materials to any End User and (b)&nbsp;the Confidential Materials are provided to Sykes to use as a resource in providing the Services and Sykes shall not publish any of the
Confidential Materials.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>9.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Degree of Care</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Without
prejudice to any other obligation under this Agreement, Sykes agrees that it shall treat all Confidential Information and all Confidential Materials with the same degree of care as it accords
to its own confidential information, and Sykes represents that it uses best efforts to protect its confidential information. Sykes may disclose the Confidential Information and the Confidential
Materials only to Sykes' employees who have a need to know such Confidential Information and/or need to use such Confidential Materials and who have previously agreed in writing to be bound by the
terms and conditions of this Agreement as they relate to Confidential Information and Confidential Materials.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>9.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Sykes' Confidential Information</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Adobe
agrees to treat as confidential any information which is proprietary to Sykes and is made available to Adobe during the Contract Term at Adobe's request, and to ensure that all appropriate
precautions are in place to ensure that all such confidential information is treated as confidential by it, its officers and employees. The foregoing obligation shall cease when the said information
enters the public domain, provided that this was not the result of a breach of the foregoing obligation by Adobe. Adobe reserves the right to disclose information provided by Sykes in the event of any
legal or administrative authority in any relevant jurisdiction so requesting such information, as well as in the event of any proceedings, either legal or administrative, in order to preserve Adobe's
interests PROVIDED THAT Adobe shall use all reasonable efforts to ensure that Sykes is notified before such disclosure (if possible) or immediately thereafter.</FONT></P>

</UL>

hereby agrees that during the Contract Term it will:&#151;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>take
such action in relation to its employees, agents and sub-contractors as Adobe may from time to time reasonably require in order to secure the effective performance by Sykes of
its obligations hereunder;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>without
prejudice to the obligations contained in Clause 2.9 of this Agreement, ensure that all systems, equipment, machinery and/or software employed by Sykes for provision of the
Services shall be of adequate quality for the performance of the Services and shall ensure that they are well maintained and shall ensure that all payments due to third parties in respect thereof
whether by way of maintenance or otherwise shall be timeously paid save in the case of any bona fide dispute;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>not,

<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>not
use Adobe's trade marks, trade names, service marks or logo(s) (except as expressly permitted hereunder in relation to the Services) without obtaining Adobe's prior written
consent;</FONT></DD></DL>

(ii)&nbsp;provided that each such sub-contractor or agent expressly agrees to assign to Adobe or such party(ies) as Adobe may designate all Intellectual Property that the sub-contractor or agent may
create or develop in its provision of the Service(s) on like terms to those contained in Clause 2.8; (f)&nbsp;perform the Services in conformity with all local laws in the territories covered by

<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(g)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>without

registrations and shall apply for all appropriate authorisations, approvals, and/or licences so as to enable an inspection and/or audit as may be appropriate or the transfer of the data to Adobe and
any third party(ies) designated by Adobe, and their holding and use by Adobe and any third party(ies) designated by Adobe, for any purposes specified by Adobe, and insofar as permitted under the
applicable privacy protection regulations and the applicable data protection regulations. Sykes shall defend, indemnify and hold Adobe and its successors, officers, directors and employees and all
third party(ies) designated by Adobe harmless against any and all costs, expenses, liabilities, losses, damages, injunctions, interdicts, suits, actions, fines, penalties, claims, proceedings and
demands of every kind or nature (including but not limited to reasonable legal fees) made against or incurred by the indemnified party in respect of claims by any person whose data are registered, or
by any government entity enforcing privacy regulations, data protection regulations or any other applicable laws, or any other party based on any regulations or any other applicable laws, in
connection with the data collected, processed, stored, registered, disclosed, maintained or transferred by Sykes or in connection with the use by Adobe or any other party(ies) designated by Adobe of
such data provided that Adobe has complied with its obligations under applicable data protection regulations and any other relevant regulations in respect of such data. Sykes' obligation of
indemnification shall survive the expiry or termination of this Agreement.</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>10.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Third Parties</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>For

<P><FONT SIZE=2>11.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;LIABILITY</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>11.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Errors or omissions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Sykes
agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Adobe and its successors, officers, directors and employees from all and any costs, expenses, liabilities, losses, damages, injunctions, interdicts, suits,
actions, fines, penalties, claims, proceedings and demands of every kind or nature (including but not limited to Adobe's reasonable legal fees) made against or incurred by the indemnified party as a
result of misrepresentation, wilful or negligent act, error or omission on the part of Sykes, its employees or sub-contractors arising out of or in any way connected with Sykes' performance of the
Services.</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>11.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Data corruption</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Without
prejudice to Sykes' obligations hereunder, Sykes shall take all reasonable steps in the performance of the Services to secure that any data (which is made available to and/or processed by
Sykes) and the Adobe network do not suffer from any corruption, deterioration or alteration or addition to them (other than as specifically provided for in terms of this Agreement) or the generation
of any errors, defects or malfunctions therein caused by:</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>18</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><HR
NOSHADE></FONT></P>

<UL>

<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the

computer instruction, circuitry, "virus", "worm", "Trojan horse" or "logic bomb" (as these words are generally understood as at the Effective Date within the computer industry)
or any other technological means whose purpose is to disrupt, damage or interfere with Adobe's use of its computer and/or telecommunications facilities, or any other similar matter or thing resulting
from such use or failure as specified in Clause 11.2 (a)&nbsp;which comes into existence or is introduced during the Contract Term.</FONT></DD></DL>
